Rebecca (Becky) Maubach, South/DCMS Art Teacher

Hi! My name is Becky Maubach. I am the new Art Teacher for South Elementary and for 5th-6th grades at Danville Community Middle School. I am very excited to continue my art adventures with Danville!
I grew up mostly going to Washington Township schools in Indianapolis, but I am originally from Bloomington, IL, where my family lives in the surrounding areas. I attended the Herron School of Art and Design/ IUPUI and have my Bachelor's in Art Education.
Before coming to Danville, I had the privilege of teaching for Decatur Township at Valley Mills Elementary. I was the Art Teacher at Valley Mills for eight years. Prior to that, I was a pottery and fine arts camp instructor for The Indianapolis Art Center, as well as an Art Reach instructor. I also have a background in Early Childhood Education, as I taught for Kindercare Learning Centers for about 9 years.
My favorite thing about teaching art is that art is for everyone! Together we can make all of the things!

Join us in giving some Warrior love to Danville Community Middle School‚Äôs Garret Hayse, Natalie Ivie and Maggie Hudson for receiving the National Junior Honor Society Outstanding Achievement Award! They recently received their medals for the award.

The NJHS Outstanding Achievement Award recognizes students that show academic excellence, participate within the community by serving others, and demonstrate leadership skills. The students who applied had to receive positive teacher recommendations, parent permission, and complete an essay about what "citizenship" means to that individual.

The award recognizes 500 exceptional NJHS students nation-wide with $500 to be placed in a college savings account. Of the hundreds of students selected and even more who applied, DCMS had three of its members chosen to receive this award. Great work, Warriors!
